Package edu.cs505.finalproject.group4.weather.client

Class WeatherClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cs505.finalproject.group4.weather.client.WeatherClient

  • public class WeatherClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The WeatherClient class is the opening wedge to the Weather Application Implementation. An HTTPRequest is made to receive the get the response from API after checking the errors/failures. ExceptionHandling is done to handle the errors and bad response if the URL is not available/invalid. The Weather data is fetched from the Weather Station API based on the WEB_URL, CURRENT_URL, PARAM_CITY_NAME, ENCODING, PARAM_MODE, MODE, PARAMAPPID, APPID and the response is returned as jasonObj which is then parsed to get the TEMP_MIN, TEMP_MAX, HUMIDITY based on the city name. It also creates an instance of the JSON Weather data parser which calls the parse method of the parser class and prints the weather data. User has option to select how they want to display the weather on screen. They can choose among the two printing styles : UnitsBased and DescriptionBased. The instance of the Visitor class is created which informs if the KnownVisitor/UnknownVisitor is at the door and the arrivalTime and left time of the Visitor.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sudha Bopini, Aditi Sharma, Neelima Ganti, Surabhi Agnihotri

      • get_and_printWeatherMessage

        public static WeatherData get_and_printWeatherMessage​(WeatherService ws)
                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                      java.text.ParseException
        We invoke the get_and_printWeatherMessage() method of the weather data service object. The OpenWebMapsWeatherService finally serves back the weather data.
        Parameters:
        ws - object of the WeatherData
        Returns:
        wd returns the weather data
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - indicate a problem with the API, attempt to parse malformed documents, problem while creating or parsing the JSON data
        java.io.IOException - whenever an input or output is failed.
